column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=If someone told you that they were scared to vote for someone who does n't believe in evolution , what would you say to that person ?

#Text=Well , I 'd say to them that , for my part , I think most people agree that Man is not an accident , and that evolution is something that 's taught in science class by state standards , they 're not set by the Federal government , really should n't be something that would enter into their mind , not a Federal issue , it 's one that 's set by the states .

#Text=I think most people that are concerned about evolution from a faith side want to see more taught about the science of how we got here , both at the very start -- how did we get the initial cells , the initial biological entities , how did we get this incredible physics set up of this planet , universe that could have a carbon-based system here , all based on science .
#Text=Just teaching science .
#Text=And to teach more science , not less , on it .
#Text=For me personally , I just have no doubt that God created us .
#Text=How he did it , what mechanisms he used , I do n't know .
#Text=The fact that he did it , I have no doubt .
#Text=You do n’t think that evolution is incompatible with an intelligent design theory ?
#Text=That we could have evolved based upon the evolution idea , but that it could have still been the work of God ?
#Text=There 's some people that look at it that way .
#Text=I think there 's some -- I think that 's kind of an interesting way of looking at it .
#Text=I do n't --
#Text=What 's your personal belief on that ?
#Text=I do n't know .
#Text=Just what I said -- that I do n't know how God did it .
#Text=A number of people would in what you 're describing a kind of , I do n't know what you 'd term it , a faith-based evolution or -- that 's not the term that some would call it .
#Text=It works .
#Text=A guy at the Human Genome Project , Francis Collins , I 've met with several times , I 've read his book The Language of God , is in that category .
#Text=And I find that very interesting .

#Text=I think there 's some rationality , too , when you look at the consistency of the genetic code between species , the different lengths , the different pieces that are in it , but there 's a lot of the same genetic language that 's there .
#Text=Where I think we 're really lost is we 're segregating science and faith .
#Text=And they ask and answer different questions .
#Text=Science asks how , and faith asks why .
#Text=And I think we 'd be so much richer , and in societies in the past in Western civilization they did this a lot more , if you had the interaction of the two , of faith and science .
#Text=Because these do n't conflict .
#Text=If they do , you need to either check your science or check your faith .
#Text=But they conflict , and for most people 's lives in the United States , they want somebody to strongly support science .
#Text=And whatever we can do to understand better the cosmos and how we work and improve our lives .
#Text=And yet it 's a faith-based country .
#Text=You have ninety percent of the country that believes in God .
#Text=Most people , they do n't see conflicts in this , and we would be so much richer if we had the discussion , rather than really trying to pit one against the other .
